channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump plans to visit Florida's new migrant detention center, 'Alligator Alcatraz'
item.description: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis said that the facility should be "ready for business" by the time Trump visits on Tuesday — despite the protests of pro-immigration, Indigenous and environmental groups.
item.content:encoded:
Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis said that the facility should be "ready for business" by the time Trump visits on Tuesday — despite the protests of pro-immigration, Indigenous and environmental groups.

(Image credit: D.A. Varela)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Most Americans feel democracy is theatened, poll shows. And, Mamdani speaks with NPR
item.description: A new poll shows that 76% of Americans believe democracy is facing a serious threat. And, Zohran Mamdani sits down with NPR to discuss his run for NYC mayor and how he tackles hate head-on.
item.content:encoded:
A new poll shows that 76% of Americans believe democracy is facing a serious threat. And, Zohran Mamdani sits down with NPR to discuss his run for NYC mayor and how he tackles hate head-on.

(Image credit: Al Drago)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: As light pollution increases, West Texas works to protect the world's largest 'dark sky reserve'
item.description: While recent research shows the night sky is getting brighter every year across North America, the Big Bend area in Texas has fended off the light glow that washes out starry nights.
item.content:encoded:
While recent research shows the night sky is getting brighter every year across North America, the Big Bend area in Texas has fended off the light glow that washes out starry nights.

(Image credit: Paul Ratje/Paul Ratje for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Carlos Morales

item.title: Mail-in voting rates dropped but early in-person voting is a hit, federal report shows
item.description: A new federal survey - taken after every major election - shows in 2024, mail-in voting was down but early, in-person voting was up. And, a shortage of poll workers is a looming problem.
item.content:encoded:
A new federal survey - taken after every major election - shows in 2024, mail-in voting was down but early, in-person voting was up. And, a shortage of poll workers is a looming problem.

(Image credit: Robyn Beck)
item.dc:creator: Ashley Lopez

item.title: Doctors don't get much menopause training. State lawmakers are trying to change that
item.description: The California legislature wants doctors to get more educated about menopause symptoms and treatment. It's one of a number of states passing menopause-related legislation.
item.content:encoded:
The California legislature wants doctors to get more educated about menopause symptoms and treatment. It's one of a number of states passing menopause-related legislation.

(Image credit: Rich Pedroncelli)
item.dc:creator: Megan Myscofski

item.title: Poll: Most feel democracy is threatened and political violence is a major problem
item.description: 76% of Americans think that democracy is under a serious threat, according to the latest NPR/PBS News/Marist poll. And their faith in political leadership in the White House and Congress is low.
item.content:encoded:
76% of Americans think that democracy is under a serious threat, according to the latest NPR/PBS News/Marist poll. And their faith in political leadership in the White House and Congress is low.

(Image credit: Kevin Dietsch)
item.dc:creator: Domenico Montanaro

item.title: Zohran Mamdani on his run for NYC mayor, taxing the rich and tackling hate head-on
item.description: New York City mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani discusses his vision for the city and his surprise win in last week's Democratic primary on Morning Edition.
item.content:encoded: New York City mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani discusses his vision for the city and his surprise win in last week's Democratic primary on Morning Edition.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Court suspends Thailand's Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra
item.description: Paetongtarn has faced growing dissatisfaction over her handling of the latest border dispute with Cambodia, involving an armed confrontation on May 28 in which one Cambodian soldier was killed.
item.content:encoded:
Paetongtarn has faced growing dissatisfaction over her handling of the latest border dispute with Cambodia, involving an armed confrontation on May 28 in which one Cambodian soldier was killed.

(Image credit: Sakchai Lalit)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: 74 killed in Gaza as Israeli forces strike a cafe and fire on people seeking food
item.description: The cafe, one of the few businesses to continue operating during the 20-month war, was a gathering spot for residents seeking internet access and a place to charge their phones.
item.content:encoded:
The cafe, one of the few businesses to continue operating during the 20-month war, was a gathering spot for residents seeking internet access and a place to charge their phones.

(Image credit: Jehad Alshrafi)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Cartel violence in Sinaloa, Mexico, leaves 20 dead, including 4 decapitated bodies
item.description: A bloody war for control between two factions of the powerful Sinaloa Cartel has turned the city of Culiacan into an epicenter of cartel violence.
item.content:encoded:
A bloody war for control between two factions of the powerful Sinaloa Cartel has turned the city of Culiacan into an epicenter of cartel violence.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
